lead_paragraph: The money, mostly loose coins, was left in the 2015 fiscal year by passengers who emptied their pockets before going through security checkpoints, the agency said.

headline.print_headline: Loose Coins at Airports Mean Funds for T.S.A.
headline.main: T.S.A. Collected Over $760,000 in Unclaimed Cash at Airports

snippet: The money, mostly loose coins, was left in the 2015 fiscal year by passengers who emptied their pockets before going through security checkpoints, the agency said.
abstract: Transportation Security Administration reports it collected over $760,000 in unclaimed cash from travelers who neglected to pick up money when passing through airport security in fiscal year 2015; most of money is in form of loose coins, and it will be used for security operations.
